Adult.description: White-tailed Kites are paler overall than Mississippi Kites with contrasting black shoulders.

Peregrine Falcons can look like a soaring Mississippi Kite, although the falcon is more powerful and less buoyant in flight. When close enough to see details, the Peregrine has a dark head and uniformly shaded wings, whereas Mississippi Kite has darker wingtips and pale patches in the secondaries.

Adult male.description: Male Northern Harriers are much paler below than adult Mississippi Kites, and also show the harrier’s typical dihedral and white rump patch unlike kites.

Immature.description: Female and young Northern Harriers can resemble young Mississippi Kites, but harriers have longer, less pointed wings, fly with their wings held in a V-shape (dihedral), and always show a white rump.
